I’m trying to implement this simple hierarchical model in Turing:
y_j | θ_j, σ_j ~ N(θ_j, σ_{j}^2$
 θ_j | μ, τ ~ N(μ, τ^2)$
with priors p(μ, τ)

Would
```@model meta(y) = begin
    μ ~ Uniform(0, 1)
    τ ~ Uniform(0, 1)
    θ ~ Normal(μ, τ^2)

    for j in eachindex(y) 
      y[j] ~  Normal(θ, τ)
    end
end```
be correct? Do I have to do anything to specify that the theta is specific to / potentially different for each y_j?
